intro: Clematis bowkeri, commonly known as the Bowker's clematis, is a vigorous climbing vine native to China. It features showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink, typically blooming in late spring to early summer. The plant has compound leaves with three to five leaflets, and its stems are covered in fine, rusty-colored hairs. It thrives in full sun to partial shade and requires well-drained soil for optimal growth. Clematis bowkeri is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and landscapes.
